to_address: "Speakup is a screen review system for Linux." <speakup@braille.uwo.ca>
subject: Re: stoping X from starting when debian etch boots
body:
Hi, If I uninstalled gdm and then wanted the startx script to start 
automatically when linux starts how would I do this?
----- Original Message ----- 
From: "Jan Buchal" 
To: "Speakup is a screen review system for Linux." 
Sent: Friday, June 01, 2007 12:47 PM
Subject: Re: stoping X from starting when debian etch boots


>>>>>> "NG" == Nick Gawronski  writes:
>
>    NG> Hi, If I am going to use software speech in gnome using orca or
>    NG> lsr do I need gdm?
> No. gdm is graphical login screen only. You can start X from bsh with
> startx script.
>
